intro: Mormolyca pudica, commonly known as the shy plant, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in dry, rocky soils. It has a low-growing habit and is often found in sunny, well-drained habitats. Due to its rare and elusive nature, it is considered a plant of special botanical interest.
